test-set.name: fn-atomic-equal
test-set.description: Tests for fn:atomic-equal (derived from tests for op:same-key)

test-case.name: atomic-equal-001
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over xs:string, xs:anyURI, and xs:untypedAtomic
test-case.test: let $keys := (xs:untypedAtomic("abc"), xs:string("abc"), xs:anyURI("abc"), xs:string("xyz"), xs:untypedAtomic("xyz")) return every $i in 1 to 5, $j in 1 to 5 satisfies (atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j]) eq (($i lt 4) eq ($j lt 4)))

test-case.name: atomic-equal-002
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal should not use the default collation

test-case.name: atomic-equal-003
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over xs:string, xs:anyURI, and xs:untypedAtomic

test-case.name: atomic-equal-005a
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over numerics: NaN and Infinity

test-case.name: atomic-equal-005b
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over numerics: NaN and Infinity

test-case.name: atomic-equal-005c
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over numerics: NaN and Infinity

test-case.name: atomic-equal-005d
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over numerics: NaN and Infinity

test-case.name: atomic-equal-005e
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over numerics: NaN and Infinity

test-case.name: atomic-equal-005f
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over numerics: NaN and Infinity

test-case.name: atomic-equal-005g
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over numerics: NaN and Infinity

test-case.name: atomic-equal-006
test-case.test: let $keys := ( xs:decimal("1.00000000000000001"), xs:decimal("1.00000000000000002"), xs:double("1.0") ) return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j])

test-case.name: atomic-equal-009
test-case.test: all(( atomic-equal(16777218, xs:double("16777218")), atomic-equal(16777218, xs:decimal("16777218")), atomic-equal(16777218, xs:float("16777218")), atomic-equal(xs:double(16777218), xs:decimal("16777218"))))

test-case.name: atomic-equal-013
test-case.test: let $without_tz := xs:dateTime('2015-04-08T01:30:00'), $with_tz := adjust-dateTime-to-timezone($without_tz, implicit-timezone()), $keys := (xs:dateTime('2015-04-08T02:30:00'), $without_tz, $with_tz) return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j])

test-case.name: atomic-equal-014
test-case.test: let $without_tz := xs:date('2015-04-08'), $with_tz := adjust-date-to-timezone($without_tz, implicit-timezone()), $keys := (xs:date('2015-04-09'), $without_tz, $with_tz) return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j])

test-case.name: atomic-equal-015
test-case.test: let $without_tz := xs:time('01:30:00') , $with_tz := adjust-time-to-timezone($without_tz, implicit-timezone()) , $keys := (xs:time('02:30:00'), $without_tz, $with_tz) return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j])

test-case.name: atomic-equal-016
test-case.test: let $date := adjust-date-to-timezone(xs:date("2015-10-10"), implicit-timezone()) , $keys := ($date cast as xs:gYear, xs:gYear("2015"), xs:gYear("2014")) return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j])

test-case.name: atomic-equal-017
test-case.test: let $date := adjust-date-to-timezone(xs:date("2015-10-10"), implicit-timezone()) , $keys := ($date cast as xs:gYearMonth, xs:gYearMonth("2015-10"), xs:gYearMonth("2015-11")) return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j])

test-case.name: atomic-equal-018
test-case.test: let $date := adjust-date-to-timezone(xs:date("2015-10-10"), implicit-timezone()) , $keys := ($date cast as xs:gMonth, xs:gMonth("--10"), xs:gMonth("--11")) return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j])

test-case.name: atomic-equal-019
test-case.test: let $date := adjust-date-to-timezone(xs:date("2015-10-10"), implicit-timezone()) , $keys := ($date cast as xs:gMonthDay, xs:gMonthDay("--10-10"), xs:gMonthDay("--11-11")) return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j])

test-case.name: atomic-equal-020
test-case.test: let $date := adjust-date-to-timezone(xs:date("2015-10-10"), implicit-timezone()) , $keys := ($date cast as xs:gDay, xs:gDay("---10"), xs:gDay("---11")) return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($keys[$i], $keys[$j])

test-case.name: atomic-equal-021
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal over xs:boolean, xs:hexBinary, xs:base64Binary, xs:duration, and xs:QName

test-case.name: atomic-equal-023
test-case.test: let $values := ("abc", "def", "xyz") return every $i in 1 to 3, $j in 1 to 3 satisfies ($i eq $j) eq atomic-equal($values[$i], xs:untypedAtomic($values[$j]))

test-case.name: atomic-equal-027
test-case.description: fn:atomic-equal values, times equal but in different timezones
